QAPair.Question: What is (are) Aminoaciduria ?
QAPair.Answer: Aminoaciduria is an abnormally high amount of amino acids in the urine. Amino acids are the building blocks for proteins in the body.

QAPair.Question: What to do for Aminoaciduria ?
QAPair.Answer: Screening infants for increased levels of amino acids can help detect problems with metabolism. Early treatment for these conditions may prevent complications in the future.
